CHAR

Zigzagging my way through life, I got too many interests and not enough time! Be it engineering, circus, gardening, or random animal facts... I got my fingers in all the pies!

About me!

I studied electrical engineering at UIUC and then managed to snag a big-kid job as an epitaxy engineer. A few years of that led me to a mental plateau and thus decided to make some real waves. I made the logical leap of moving to Chicago to train as a circus performer. There, I discovered my love of contortion.

While I love contortion and can't give it up, I felt I had left something behind when I dropped everything to join the circus. A certain puzzle-solving mindset. And so, I enrolled in Flatiron's Software Engineering course.

I now get to have a lovely balanace of mental and physical stimulation that keeps me on all my literal and metaphorical toes.

Technical Skills

  • Backend and Frontend experience
  • Familiarity with Ruby/Rails/React, Javascript
  • HTML, CSS, SCSS
  • History with Python, MATLAB, Java
  • SQL, Postgres, Excel

Projects

The following are some culminating projects done during my time with Flatiron as well as personal projects. The purpose was to showcase mastery and a solid understanding in certain topics. But also they were pretty fun to do.

Six Clicks

A wikirace style game that I've put on Heroku. Choose a starting and ending point and count the number pages it takes to get to the target page.

  • Create a React App
  • Understand stateless components
  • Make use of react-router and proper RESTful routing
  • Use Redux middleware and redux-thunk
  • Interact with a Rails API

video demo | github

Pummel

A simple game styled after Whack-a-mole. Use the numpad to bop the baddies and game points. Check it out here.

  • Integrate JavaScript and Rails
  • Asynchronous interactions between the client and server using JSON
  • Understand object oriented programming in a JS applications
  • Use a Rails backend and understand associations

video demo | github

trivichar

A collaborative trivia app. Make different rounds and questions and publish them for others to play. Take a look here.

  • Use the Ruby on Rails framework and MVC architecture
  • Understand validations to defend against invalid data
  • Have user authentication
  • Understand nested resources with the appropriate RESTful syntax

video demo | github

flishflash

An app to create and organize flashcards into groups and be able to practice with them.

  • Build an MVC Sinatra application
  • Use Active Record using mutiple models and relationships
  • Have user authentication and input validations
  • Use RESTful syntax to create, edit, and destroy resources

video demo | github

purkamyern

A CLI Pokedex using the PokeAPI. Save and access pokemon that have been sighted. The project simulates a single device that could potentially be connected to others for "global" statistics.

  • Build a CLI
  • Access Data from an external source
  • Use Ruby

video demo | github

circuschar

My circus portfolio page. It's got pictures and videos!

  • Uses a bootstrap template
  • Be able to read the original author's code in order to understand where/how to change things for my own purposes
